header: CNR No.MHPU01-000257-2019 Mahesh Anand Jategaonkar Vs. State of Maharashtra (Bundgarden Police Station )

background.text: Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No. 68 /2019 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.03/2019, registered with Bundgarden Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.7 of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988.

arguments.text: 2. On 02/01/2019, the applicant/accused, who is Peon of Health Department of Pune Municipal Corporation, caught by Anti­ Corruption Bureau, Pune raid handed while accepting bribe amount of Rs.500/­ from original complainant­Akshay Kamble for giving death certificate.

argumentSentences.text: On 02/01/2019, the applicant/accused, who is Peon of Health Department of Pune Municipal Corporation, caught by Anti­ Corruption Bureau, Pune raid handed while accepting bribe amount of Rs.500/­ from original complainant­Akshay Kamble for giving death certificate.

arguments.text: 3. Learned counsel for applicant­accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence. He further submitted that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary. Therefore, he be released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: Learned counsel for applicant­accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence.
He further submitted that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary.
Therefore, he be released on bail.

arguments.text: 4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that applicant/accused was caught by ACB Pune while accepting bribe amount of Rs.500/­, and investigation is to be completed, therefore, his bail application be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: On the other hand, learned APP submitted that applicant/accused was caught by ACB Pune while accepting bribe amount of Rs.500/­, and investigation is to be completed, therefore, his bail application be rejected.

arguments.text: 5. On perusing record, prima facie, it reveals that original complainant­Akshay Kamble approached to Health Department of Pune Municipal Corporation for death certificate of his deceased father. At that time, the applicant­accused demanded bribe amount, therefore, he approached to ACB, Pune, who by following due procedure, caught the applicant/accused,while accepting bribe 2 amount of Rs.500/­. It is seems that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is now not necessary, Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: On perusing record, prima facie, it reveals that original complainant­Akshay Kamble approached to Health Department of Pune Municipal Corporation for death certificate of his deceased father.

At that time, the applicant­accused demanded bribe amount, therefore, he approached to ACB, Pune, who by following due procedure, caught the applicant/accused,while accepting bribe 2 amount of Rs.500/­.

It is seems that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is now not necessary, Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicant­Mahesh Anand Jategaonkar, be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicant­accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicant­accused shall attend Anti­Corruption Bureau,Pune, on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. v. The applicant­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicant­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicant­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case.

processedText:
CNR No.MHPU01-000257-2019 Mahesh Anand Jategaonkar Vs. State of Maharashtra (Bundgarden Police Station ) 
---header-ends---
Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No. 68 /2019 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.03/2019, registered with Bundgarden Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.7 of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988. 
---background-ends---
2. On 02/01/2019, the applicant/accused, who is Peon of Health Department of Pune Municipal Corporation, caught by Anti­ Corruption Bureau, Pune raid handed while accepting bribe amount of Rs.500/­ from original complainant­Akshay Kamble for giving death certificate. 
---argument-ends---
3. Learned counsel for applicant­accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence. He further submitted that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary. Therefore, he be released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that applicant/accused was caught by ACB Pune while accepting bribe amount of Rs.500/­, and investigation is to be completed, therefore, his bail application be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5. On perusing record, prima facie, it reveals that original complainant­Akshay Kamble approached to Health Department of Pune Municipal Corporation for death certificate of his deceased father. At that time, the applicant­accused demanded bribe amount, therefore, he approached to ACB, Pune, who by following due procedure, caught the applicant/accused,while accepting bribe 2 amount of Rs.500/­. It is seems that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is now not necessary, Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicant­Mahesh Anand Jategaonkar, be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicant­accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicant­accused shall attend Anti­Corruption Bureau,Pune, on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. v. The applicant­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicant­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicant­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case. 
---order-ends---
Date :05/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge,Pune 3 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. Gore, Stenographer Grade­I Court Name : K.D. Vadane , Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune Date : 05/01/2019 order signed by presiding officer on : 05/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 05/01/2019
